meanings.definition: The act of administering a dose of medication.
meanings.sent1: The nurse carefully performed the dosing of the patient's medication.
meanings.sent2: The doctor instructed the patient on the proper dosing schedule for the antibiotics.
meanings.sent3: The dosing of the medicine was so precise that it seemed like a magic potion.
meanings.sent4: Her dosing of kindness towards others was truly heartwarming.
meanings.sent5: The dosing of the cough syrup made the taste unbearable.

meanings.definition: The amount of medication prescribed to be taken at one time.
meanings.sent1: The correct dosing for this painkiller is one tablet every six hours.
meanings.sent2: She always followed the dosing instructions on the label of the medicine bottle.
meanings.sent3: The dosing of laughter from the comedy show was contagious.
meanings.sent4: His dosing of determination was evident in his consistent workout routine.
meanings.sent5: The dosing of sugar in the recipe made the cookies too sweet.

meanings.definition: The process of measuring and administering a specific amount of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist ensured the accurate dosing of the liquid medication for the child.
meanings.sent2: Precision is crucial in the dosing of ingredients for a successful recipe.
meanings.sent3: The dosing of sunlight in the morning was invigorating.
meanings.sent4: Her dosing of creativity in the project brought a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The dosing of fertilizer in the garden led to vibrant blooms.
